summary: The Survivors Assistance for Fear-free and Easy Tax Filing Act of 2025 (SAFE Tax Filing Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow certain abused or abandoned spouses to file as unmarried or heads of households. It defines domestic abuse and spousal abandonment, allowing individuals meeting the criteria to elect to be treated as unmarried.  The bill also introduces due diligence requirements for tax return preparers to assess eligibility under the new provisions. The amendments apply to taxable years ending after the date of enactment.
